docs.snippet: Mitch McConnell’s words regarding a Senate action against Elizabeth Warren became a rallying cry on social media.

headline.main: ‘Nevertheless, She Persisted’: How Senate’s Silencing of Warren Became a Meme

docs.snippet: Hundreds of vocal activists have gone missing in recent months. When they return, they are changed.
Despite the many competing platforms that now allow for the public airing of opinions and grievances, The Times’s letters section is as robust a forum as ever.

headline.main: ‘To the Editor’: What Happens When Readers Write Back?

docs.snippet: A fashion critic likes tech that is efficient, functional and solves problems.

headline.print_headline: Eyes on the Runway, Fingers on an iPhone 5
headline.main: Covering Fashion Shows With a Functional iPhone Keyboard

docs.snippet: The authorities in Russia questioned the performance artist Pyotr Pavlensky and his partner after an actress accused them of sexual assault.

headline.print_headline: Russian Artist to Seek Asylum in France
headline.main: Russian Dissident Artist Will Seek Asylum in France

docs.snippet: Jost Franko photographed the global path of cotton — from plantation to factory — where the corporate quest for cheaper production sometimes obscures the human cost.

headline.main: A Glimpse of the Workers Who Make Your Clothes

docs.abstract: Jost Franko photographed the global path of cotton — from plantation to factory — where the corporate quest for cheaper production sometimes obscures the human cost.

docs.snippet: When passengers on a Manhattan train spotted hateful messages scrawled on a subway map, they joined together to get rid of them.

headline.print_headline: With Ample Purell, Riders Scrub Graffiti
headline.main: Subway Riders Scrub Anti-Semitic Graffiti, as ‘Decent Human Beings’

docs.snippet: For some, replacing the Italian capital’s yellow sodium lamps with cheaper, more environmentally friendly, white LED bulbs is not modernization, but heresy.

headline.print_headline: Streetlight Fight Breaks Out in Rome: Golden Glow vs. Harsh White LED
headline.main: Streetlight Fight in Rome: Golden Glow vs. Harsh LED

docs.snippet: The demonstration on Wednesday, in which women skipped work, wore red and refused to spend money, drew far smaller crowds than the Women’s Marches in January.

headline.print_headline: A Strike by Women, but Turnout Is Modest
headline.main: ‘Day Without a Woman’ Protest Tests a Movement’s Staying Power

docs.snippet: Since taking office on June 30, Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines has made it open season on drug dealers and users, whose killings have been documented by brave and dedicated local journalists.

headline.main: Duterte’s War on Drugs Through a Local Photographer’s Eyes

docs.abstract: Since taking office on June 30, Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines has made it open season on drug dealers and users, whose killings have been documented by brave and dedicated local journalists.
